intro: Silphium asperrimum, commonly known as the harsh silphium, is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in dry, rocky soils. The plant features a robust, upright stem with narrow, gray-green leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in flat-topped clusters, typical of the daisy family. Silphium asperrimum is known for its medicinal properties and was historically valued in ancient herbal medicine.
